body:
Hi guys



Rhino does not use independent installations of IronPython, but they can conflict with the version loaded from Rhino's installation folder. As such, you should **not** install different IronPython versions to begin with. [See more information](https://discourse.mcneel.com/t/ironpython-installation-rhino-5-rhino-wip/40927).



If required, then rather install the exact version that you are using with Rhino, or disable the **GAC option** while installing.



Besides, \N is not a good character escape. It should be \n. \n is a new line escape. [\N is undefined](https://docs.python.org/2.0/ref/strings.html), even in Python 2.0, and as such, can create issues. I am not an expert regarding under which conditions an error will be raised for this problem, rather than being silently ignored.
